For details, please refer to the leaflets.

lifestyle.landingPage.header: Become a better version of yourself !
lifestyle.landingPage.description-first: Discover actionable insights on your health status. Enjoy personalised recommendations to improve your daily wellbeing.
lifestyle.landingPage.description-second: Don’t worry, no data is shared with your employer.
lifestyle.lifestyleOverview.description: Remember, your health is primarily a result of your lifestyle.
lifestyle.lifestyleScore.description: Higher scores are associated with better lifestyle choices and lower risks of chronic disease.
lifestyle.lifestyleResults.bmiCard.title: BMI
lifestyle.lifestyleResults.bmiCard.descr: Great job! Your BMI is in the healthy zone. Continue to eat well and exercise regularly to stay healthy.
You are at high risk of developing multiple health problems. Consider consulting a doctor on ways to change your dietary and lifestyle habits to get healthy.
You are at risk of developing multiple health problems. Change your dietary and lifestyle habits to get healthier.
You are at risk of developing multiple health problems. Change your dietary and lifestyle habits to get healthier.
Awesome! Maintain a healthy lifestyle to keep your diabetes risk low. Take an online diabetes risk assessment at least yearly should your lifestyle change.
Consider going for pre-diabetes health screening even if you feel perfectly well. Early detection can result in better outcomes. Click to learn more.

You are potentially pre-diabetic. Early detection can guide you in changing your lifestyle and result in better outcomes.  Take a pre-diabetes health screening even if you feel perfectly well. Click to learn more.
lifestyle.lifestyleResults.alcoholRiskCa: Congratulations! Keeping to a “no” or “low” alcohol lifestyle can be tough socially but minimises alcohol-related risks. Encourage others around you to do the same!
Enjoy yourself but remember the count! Be careful not to exceed 2 standard drinks a day. Stay informed about alcohol-related risks and dependencies.
Your current consumption is high and potentially harmful to your body. Reduce your alcohol intake to lessen alcohol-related health risks.
lifestyle.lifestyleResults.tobaccoRiskCa: Good job! Take care of your health by avoiding second-hand smoke. Encourage others around you to stop smoking also!
Bravo! Quitting is a significant achievement. Take care of your health by avoiding second-hand smoke. Encourage others around you to stop smoking also!
Consider quitting to reduce tobacco-related health risks. Your lungs start to heal after a month and you will see improvements in your taste, smell, immunity, energy levels, and more!
lifestyle.lifestyleResults.exerciseRiskC: Well done! Consistency is key for you. Try 7 light cardio days that burn 200 calories per session than 2 brutal days that burn 700. Or learn new exercise routines for a change.
There are plenty of health benefits with regular exercise. While you do do some exercise, try planning more intensive and regular daily exercises activities.
Being active helps you look and feel good! Starting is always the hardest but find an excuse to walk at least 30 minutes a day, 3 times a week! Or try some activities you can do at home.
lifestyle.lifestyleResults.nutritionRisk: Temptations and our food choices can affect our body in many ways. Learn how your diet impacts your health risks and how taking control of what you eat can lead to better outcomes.
Controlling and resisting temptation to certain foods can be difficult in your culture. Learn about healthy alternatives to help you stay focused on keeping a healthy diet.
You understand self-control and good nutrition is the key to maintaining a healthy diet. Stay informed to help you and your family continue on your healthy nutrition journey.
lifestyle.lifestyleResults.sleepRiskCard: Nice! Try to maintain at least 8 hours sleep each night. It helps you to stay focused and avoid sleep-related health problems.
A good night’s sleep allows the body to rest and recover so you are ready for a productive day ahead. Make sleep a higher priority and try to improve the quality of your sleep.
Inadequate sleep can contribute to heart disease, diabetes and impaired cognition. Consider seeking professional help to identify contributing factors and improve the quality of your sleep.
lifestyle.lifestyleResults.mindAndStress: Keep it up! Focus on the present. Don't get caught up thinking about the past or worrying too much into the future. Mental wellness is as important as physical wellness. Self-assess your mental wellness on a regular basis.

Besides physical health, it is equally important to take care of your mental wellbeing. Your health will suffer if you feel depressed often. Take time to identify and manage the sources of your negative emotions.
Set time aside to unwind or your mental and physical health can suffer. Identify and manage the sources of your negative emotions. It can be difficult doing this alone and it’s okay to seek support!
lifestyle.questionnaire.description: We combined questions from the latest scientific tools to help us access your lifestyle risks
lifestyle.questionnaire.aboutMe.ethnicit: The classification based on BMI would be different for Asian and non-Asian races. Research shows that Asians have more than double the risk of developing type 2 diabetes than Caucasians.
lifestyle.questionnaire.futureMe.descrip: Upload a selfie and we will analyse and predict the future you.
lifestyle.questionnaire.futureMe.imageDe: Only .jpeg, .PNG or Tiff files and size should not exceed more than 2mb.
lifestyle.questionnaire.disclaimerMessag: This questionnaire is designed to provide you with an indication of your lifestyle and its impact on your health/wellness. It is NOT intended to constitute professional medical advice, diagnosis or treatment, and is NOT a substitute for a medical health assessment by a qualified medical professional. If you’re experiencing signs and symptoms we recommend you seek medical attention from a qualified medical professional. By submitting this questionnaire, you do so in at your own choice and in agreement with this disclaimer.
lifestyle.faceAging.description: Move the slider to view your future appearance when you live a healthier lifestyle.
lifestyle.faceAging.analyzing.inProgress: Analyzing in progress. This may take a little while.
lifestyle.faceAging.error.unableProcess: We are unable to process the photo you uploaded.
lifestyle.faceAging.error.retryUpload: Please retry uploading a selfie and we will analyse and predict the future you.
